meanings.sent1: Many customers made preorders for the new video game.
meanings.sent2: The store received a lot of preorders for the upcoming book release.
meanings.sent3: The preorders for the limited edition sneakers sold out in minutes!
meanings.sent4: Her stack of preorders for the concert tickets was as tall as a skyscraper.
meanings.sent5: The company's success was evident from the overwhelming number of preorders.

meanings.definition: To place an order before something is available
meanings.sent1: She preorders her favorite products to ensure she gets them on time.
meanings.sent2: Customers often preorder new technology to be among the first to have it.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly preorders his breakfast the night before at the diner.
meanings.sent4: Preordering the latest fashion trends is like predicting the future of style.
meanings.sent5: The action figure enthusiast eagerly preorders collectibles as soon as they are announced.

meanings.definition: The act of ordering something before it is released
meanings.sent1: The company's success was evident from the overwhelming number of preorders.
meanings.sent2: Preorders for the limited edition sneakers sold out in minutes.
meanings.sent3: The preorders for the concert tickets were like a race to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The surge in preorders indicated high anticipation for the new album.
meanings.sent5: The preorders flooded in as soon as the product was announced.
